intro: Dalechampia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature common in many members of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia laevigata is often found in moist, wooded areas and can grow up to several feet tall.
